This page contains links to useful sources on statistics, `R` and other software packages. 

* [CRAN Task View: Statistics for the Social Sciences](https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/SocialSciences.html)
* [CRAN Task Views](https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/)
* [Cross Validated](https://stats.stackexchange.com)
* [DataCamp](https://www.datacamp.com/)
* [Math Camp Lectures - UW CSSS](http://csss.washington.edu/academics/math-camp/lectures)
* [Personality Project](http://personality-project.org/index.html)
* [Quick-R](http://www.statmethods.net/)
* [R for Data Science](http://r4ds.had.co.nz/)
* [R Weekly](https://rweekly.org/)
* [R-statistics.co](http://r-statistics.co/)
* [Rseek](https://rseek.org/)
* [RStudio Community](https://community.rstudio.com/)
* [Seeing Theory](http://students.brown.edu/seeing-theory/)
* [Statistical Modeling, Causal Inference, and Social Science (a.k.a., Andrew Gelman's Blog)](http://andrewgelman.com)
* [STHDA (Statistical Tools for High-throughput Data Analysis)](http://www.sthda.com/english/)
* [The R Graph Gallery](http://www.r-graph-gallery.com/)
* [UCLA IDRE - Annotated Output](https://stats.idre.ucla.edu/other/annotatedoutput/)
